header.topics: English language, friends, presents, work, relationships, holidays, car problems, pets, family
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, anecdote telling, telling jokes

body.u: yeah it reminds me of doing my dissertation oh it's a small
shame even where it says it will all be anonymous I kinda feel like I'd like my name on there
anonymised brackets
you're a funny one so if it's aimed at language learners
yeah
as in people coming to England? as in foreign people learning the English language based on examples of those speaking the English language?
yeah
right okay
yeah they just want loads and loads of examples
that would be hilarious if you had a load of west country people and you had French and German so coming over and they were all speaking like that
yeah hello my lovely hello there
dictionary of pronunciation
there you are
oh thank you so much oh tea
ladies who's having peppermint?
oh peppermint very sophisticated
thank you
might put that there as that might be better
yes thank you interesting yes you could get a snack afterwards
I'm quite hungry
have you heard anything from?
I got a text from actually
did you?
yeah I got a text from and she never replied again
that's weird no is having a
was it and had a row over their flat?
still a bit funny with it yeah I don't think
does this thing just all the time when it's like let's Skype let's Skype but it's always like well you're not actually going to do it so why say it? and that occurred a few months ago in
this was before
she broke up with
oh I didn't know that
that doesn't surprise me they met too young
yeah
cosmopolitan
yeah all that jazz and I do feel quite sorry for and
we met up with her quite recently we went to Pizza Express
where?
Pizza Express near
oh
at that stage she was still in contact with him and they still met up and it's a bit like
yeah
people still have
yeah exactly maybe out of pity
yeah maybe
if she's free of him she's been going on about that for ages she should move on
yeah find a London boy
yeah
you said I don't have an accent
you do everyone has an accent
it's standard boring boring accent
yeah boring
sorry
where do you currently live?
England
I suppose that's I think and met up for New Year's together didn't they?
yeah
yeah gets a bit complicated in the end some people were doing things and I was like nah

I know I thought it was a bit weird cos she posted on Facebook I didn't see it until way after she'd posted it but erm she posted oh what are you doing for New Year? I'll go near or far and I was like I've already like told you what I'm doing so why?
near or far aka London
she basically won't go outside London cos otherwise so I didn't bother replying to that either it's like I've told you my plans yeah
either come or don't come
yeah
topic or subject oh right you said don't worry about that
about her home
yes have they actually?
I don't know
all I got was the email that you guys got as well that's just like oh like we've broken up and I'm really sad it's the best thing I they broken up
I knew that wasn't going to last either
I don't
yeah
huh why?
cos he posted something recently on Facebook oh like look at me right across the table but still missing loads
what am I doing? writing first to the
and then he may of realised that he'd made a bit of a mistake
yeah does he live in Spain now?
that's the thing cos he works for his dad or something they've got a lot of money apparently doing quite a lot
what's he actually doing is he actually doing reporting with him then?
I can't even write the date down
oh yeah it's twenty fifteen did you write twenty fifteen? let's see let's see interesting you did
ah I'm so with it
so how's your teaching job going?
yesgood it is good it's tiring
thanks
as expected
you all said NQT year's the worst year but I touch wood am not finding it as stressful as people made out
yes

I feel like I should find it more stressful but I am tired it's tiring but you don't have uni to go to as well you don't have dissertations to do I saw someone one a train writing a dissertation and I was like I'll never have to do that again
like having Christmas without having homework
yes that's been nice did you have a good New Year in the end?
I did I went to with my friends and who I kept calling you know sometimes I call you
yeah

she's blonde they're both blonde basically the same person and yeah we went to this pub it was only a fiver and I thought it was going to be sedate but it was a really modern pub and there were loads of people there and it had this huge dance floor so it was basically like being in a club but I only paid a fiver
that's cool
good
better than last year you didn't enjoy it last year
well I don't remember it
last year I made a puzzle globe last year that's tragic
oh no
were you ill or something?
my plans fell through I gave dad a puzzle globe for Christmas and I had nothing else to do so I made the globe and sat there
oh sounds better than my New Year last year I paid fifty quid for this really cool evening in London
I remember
an then we got completely wasted before we even left the flat I don't remember anything during the night and I apparently made a fool of myself apparently I insulted so which wasn't great
oh dear
anyway tell me about
is a German boy who's twenty-eight years old
and did you meet him did how where were you?
basically I got this part time job when I was a language student I got this part time job
in a school did you enjoy doing that by the way?

yes I enjoyed it I enjoyed it I think and it was only twelve hours a week and I was getting eight hundred euros a month so that's nice not too bad but I don't think I'd do teaching I think I've done my year
and that's enough
because I did quite enjoy planning lessons and stuff but the kids just wouldn't cooperate they were like
they were older weren't they?
they were so unimaginative so I planned this lesson where they had to create a TV show
how old were they?
they were sixteen and I thought oh that would be an interesting way for them to get active
yeah

so I put them into groups and I said plan a TV show you've got half an hour and they're so unimaginative in Germany they sit there they just sat there at the table and they were all writing and there was silence and I was like guys you don't have to write you can talk to each other but they just couldn't grasp this fact that they didn't write stuff down and that they couldn't be creative and that showed they were really boring they were really dull I said
did they have to speak in English to you?

they had to speak in English yeah they had to do like a cookery show and like a chat show and something else and I thought that would be really fun but they didn't get it they didn't understand the whole concept of it
yeah

so anyway that was a bit of a disaster hey ho but I had this part time job as a waitress in this restaurant and it's owned by parents and he was a chef there and he after about a couple weeks he came up to me cos I'd never fancied him or anything
did he have a girlfriend at work though?
he had a girlfriend at works he but he broke up with her like two weeks before
said two week ago

yeah she was Hungarian and yeah he followed me out one night he followed me out one day when I was leaving and he said by the way I was wondering I you wanted to go out for a drink or something or a staff outing and I was like oh what's happening? and he was like oh no just you and me and I thought like I really kind be bothered with this but I didn't want to hurt his feelings so I was like yeah sounds good I'll text you so I text him and I was like yeah let's go out and this was on Sunday and he was like let's go out Tuesday and I was like oh god that's serious so I to put him off me I scraped my hair up didn't wear any makeup and wore my glasses cos I was like I really can't be bothered to start a relationship like so close to the end of my time here it was only like a month before I left
that's funny
I went to pub and actually really enjoyed myself and we went out for dinner again a few days later
you didn't put makeup on?
that time I did and make myself look nice and yeah we saw each other every single day always doing stuff together
did you speak German with him?
yeah we always speak German with each other and then he took me out for a weekend away in Poland
that's so nice
in a five star hotel with a bar and everything
nice find

and I was still going into it thinking it'll be fun for a month and then at the end we were like oh we don't want to break up so he booked a flight to come and see me cos I was between Germany and Peru and that was really cool and we were like okay still want to be with you and we carried on the relationship while we were in Peru and we Skype all the time and he came to visit me yeah
yeah I saw the photos
does he speak English at all?
he does speak English he speaks English French and German
oh my god
cos he trained as a chef in France yeah he trained as a chef in France so he speaks French as well
is his English good?
his English is good I mean he makes a few mistakes but nothing major
do you speak to him in German?
yeah unless we're like when we're with my parents we speak English we
that's amazing that you can do that
he's sending me love letters and they're really cute things like origami hearts and stuff like that
oh god

one of the letters was in German and then in English and the last page was in French and I said to him I can't read the last page and he was like oh you have to work out yourself so I had to do on google translate which took ages had to type it all up but yeah that was quite romantic
romantic

yeah but then for my birthday he did this really cute thing he left like a week two weeks before my birthday and we were going to do presents in February when I was going to go out there and so anyway I went down and the doorman said oh I've got something here for you and he gave me freeze dried rose which was given to me and a card saying happy birthday I came and he'd given a present to the maid cos we had a maid in our room and put on my bed like and so there was a present and a card and I was like oh that's cute but it wasn't just that I opened that and then the card said right go into your computer and open this password protected document but you've got to find the password which was referring to our last love letter so I had to go and get the last love letter out and find this password which spelt out I love you
oh my god
and then the word document right now you've got to find
was he in the country?
no he'd left already
oh
darling PS I love you
look where your last present was but deeper so I looked under the bed and it was there and I thought oh it's another present is this the last one? and there was a card
pass the parcel

yeah and I was like when's this going to end and I opened the card and it said right now you've been searching for a long time I think you need a drink go to this pub and buy this particular drink so I was like oh what's there what's waiting there for me? so my friend and I went to this particular pub but unfortunately it had closed down the day before
oh no

cos it was open the night before cos I saw it and there was just a big sign on the door saying we have closed down for the foreseeable future so I was like oh great so I'm never going to get what was left so anyway a few days later I left a note on the door that said if you see this can you give me a ring cos I really I think my boyfriend left a present with you and anyway he rang me and said yeah come and collect it so it didn't quite work out the way wanted but I did get my present in the end
what was it?
and that was the end of the treasure hunt erm it was it's like so it sounds really weird it's like a block of plastic in a kind of a cube shape and at the back of the plastic is a picture of us
oh okay I know the kind of you can slot it in
no it's inside
oh
yeah
oh wow
aw that's cute so romantic
how old is he?
twenty-eight
oh my god I hear wedding bells I have to say all the shitty relationships that you've been through I'm so glad that you've finally got a gooden
did he propose on Machu Picchu?
no
did you really think he would?
I don't think I would of said yes anyway as it's a bit early but
how long have you been together?
since the beginning of May
that's amazing
the first day he arrived cos we'd never said I love you before
but in letters you had

no I hadn't ever said it and I thought I don't want to do it over Skype I want to do it when we see each other oh I said it first and he was like oh I really hate you and I was like why? and said cos I planned to say it on Machu Picchu and I was like sorry you can still say it on Machu Picchu yeah but it's not going to be sweet now is it?
oh that's so romantic well you always get flowers and teddies
yeah he's always been good like that not like planned like a now I feel like a bad girlfriend cos he does all these things and I just
that's what they're meant to do that's their role
yeah I know
when he came it was his birthday in October when he came in November I bought him a cake with a candle and put some music on and bought myself some new underwear
did you?

and I made him go have a shower when he arrived so that I could that I could plan it all well it was actually on my bed the cake in the middle of my bed on one side and a romantic evening I had wine so I bought wine and I put two glasses of wine and I had two glasses of wine and standing there in my underwear and then he came in I was like happy birthday but it was no way near as romantic as what he did for me
that's nice though
he loved that
so what's the plan is he going to come here what's the plan?
well I don't want to move to Germany and I want him to move to London with me
he could start a restaurant

he could do that thing is he works in the restaurant with his parents and they're really quite pushy that he stays in the restaurant cos it's like a family business and I said what would happen if he left ? and was like oh they'll probably never talk to me again which I'm sure is an exaggeration they would talk to him again but he was like they'll be really upset it I just walked away from the business and my mum was like that's was professional at all it's his life but I think cos it's his parents he feels like it's an obligation
wow
so I don't know what's going to happen
mind you imagine they're not there what do you want?
I should have that conversation
dream
when he next came up imagine I'm going out to Germany for the twentieth of January for two weeks and then
so you're freelancing so to be honest I don't think you can really have a job unless it's online

no I've got an interview on the twelfth here in London not here here but in London and so hopefully if I get that job which I hope but I might not get it they won't want me until February anyway but I can always say sorry I've got a holiday booked can I start in February?
yeah what's the job?
it's in it's called and it's a film TV and literary agency
wow
it's only a six month job
how did you get that then?

well when before I went to uni I wrote letters to loads and loads of publishing companies and most of them emailed me back with loads of rejections and there were a few really positive ones where I did work experience so what I did was the other month I emailed them all again cos I still had all their emails and I emailed them all again and I said I did my work experience with them and here's my CV and I've since been to uni and done all this and blah blah if there's any opportunities please let me know and this girl emailed me back saying yes we're looking to fill an internship from kind of the new year if you're available and we'll have a look at your CV and say if you're suitable and a few days later she emailed me back and said yes we'd like to see you
that's good
wow
but I don't know how many people
what job would it be in the company do you have any idea?
I think it's like agency for the literary department so I'm not sure exactly what I'll be doing
the dreams
yeah
get a job and then move to London
and then you're like you can't move to Germany you're going to have to move here

yeah well he knows I'm looking for jobs in London anyway so I'm hoping he'll just break and just come and he did say to me the other day and just come and he did say to me the other day on Skype if only I could give everything up to come to London with you and I was like mm that's a promising sign and I was like yeah that would be lovely
can he make the family business go bust?
oh nightmare
he could extend it it could be international it could be the same company but in London I mean how long is it to get there from here what's the flight?
it's like an hour and a half
that's good and once you've done all your travelling in between what does that equate to like how far is he from the airport?

well if I fly to Berlin it's two hours from the airport if I fly to Leipzig if I flew to Dresden it's like half an hour like I would never consider flying to Dresden erm Leipzig is about two hours the opposite direction and he's picking me up form Leipzig when I go in January and we're going to go to his sister who lives in Switzerland and stay there for a few days well two days
you're like living the dream
did you go skiing?

I did in Germany in February yeah in Bavaria it was really fun but I kept falling off it was quite hard actually yeah did I tell you? right you really need to watch and I was doing it really slowly each time and I was like I've just got to let myself go and I was like just help me here and got to the top and I just let go and I was like the first I did it I got right to the end and I still haven't got anything to slow myself so I just used to sit on my bum and that used to stop myself so I'd just sit down before I bumped into the queue of people at the bottom so anyway I thought that was cool I'll do that again to I did it again and there was like a man who was doing a skiing lesson with kids and he could see and they started to skate across as I was coming down
yeah they do that they start skating across

and I was like oh my god I can't stop and I moved a tiny bit and fortunately I hit the teacher and not any of the kids and I bashed my head and I had a headache for the whole day and I bashed my head on the snow but fortunately I didn't take out any four year olds
bad
not as bad as it could of been
ho was ?
no he was fine cos he's like an experienced skier
did you speak to him in French of German?
no he was American actually he was like oh you got to be more careful I was like sorry
I'm a novice
they just stand on the slope having a chat they don't get out the way
so funny family have a chalet in France and they were skiing a few days ago
whereabouts in France?

they were all experienced skiers but it hilarious his aunt reminds me a bit of Dawn French a bit big quite jolly and the visibility the other day was really bad and they know the slopes quite well because they always go to the same place but for some reason she was going really fast as like it was the funniest thing she was going really fast and she just disappeared over the front and just landed it's actually quite dangerous but they were laughing cos she was fine and landed like in snow landed like an angel in snow up to here and she spent ages looking for her skis but stuff like that makes me laugh but apparently she just literally just went dum dum dum
I guess she's quite fat
yeah that's true
I could never get I always had to take my skis off cos I could never get myself up I do have poor body strength to do that to do it from your tummy yeah so I couldn't do that
did it go on the you know when you sit down?
yeah I did that nightmare if you fall off it's like damn it
so you're here you going to do your freelancing you're going to try and get that job
yes but I've only got one interview lined up so if that fails I'm back to square one cos I've been applying for so many jobs
I think you've got a good chance I think they'll really the fact that you've applied and that you applied again shows commitment
keen yeah she sent me a load of authors that they agent for which I've got to research and stuff so I suppose I better do that I better find some nice shoes
just don't go in in those trainers
what happened to your other shoes?
I don't have any more I used to have some black shoes that I used to wear to work every day in Peru but I wore them every single day and they just got holes in the end
well it's the sales
shoes are important
yeah it's just that this month cos I don't get cos I've been doing races as well you know I did races I did so whenever I can do casual work I can and I did one at on Boxing day cos it was double pay
is that when you're on the tills?
yeah
is that when you take the next bets out
yeah so I did one I did one at
get any good tips?
no rubbish and yesterday I did one at I got offered one at Festival but if I get this job Festival is not until March so if I accept Festival and get this job
no definitely get this job Festival will come and go
get a job
if I don't accept it and don't get the job then I haven't got
can you accept it and then if you get the job?
I could yeah I could but I don't want to get a reputation for bad and then they might not offer me any more work cos it is quite good to do it on Saturdays and stuff when you're free
but if you got a job then you won't need any more work

yeah true I won't enjoy it though I might want to carry on doing it I might want to do if I can well obviously if I have a job it might be difficult but I really enjoy doing but yeah you're right I probably won't need it as much if I get this job but I didn't think I'll accept festival until I've got this interview until I've had this interview yeah I did yesterday so I've been trying to earn money in bits and pieces where I can but I want something permanent but all this money I don't get realised until the end of the month anyway so this month I've had to be
mine's been shit cos they've paid on the twenty-third December did they do that with you?
yeah
it's really annoying
I hate it when that happens
that dent I made in the car
where did you make that?
I made it in October I was so good at keeping it a secret from my parents
why is it your car or theirs?

it's theirs and all the times I kept it quiet and I was like I kept it quiet all the time I made them park it somewhere and then walk round to my house everything literally and then at Christmas oh I'm going to wash the cars and I was like oh no I'll do mine
very stressful for you having that
and I was like I know it was and I said I was like no seriously I was like you know give me that car you know I'm paying it off
I'll wash it

I must do it and then dad the next morning before I woke up was like how did you do the dent? why don't I know about it? and I learn from my mistakes I very much do and I was like in my head hide the dent but dad was like that was so stupid because you can't claim for it on the insurance now because you have to claim in two weeks
not that you'd want to either you wouldn't want to claim against that
it's probably cheaper to get it
nightmare the mechanics and I've now I've paid dad off and the insurance is a nightmare with my points
you've got points
why have you got points?

speeding I'm sure I told you that ages ago and then we sent it to the mechanic and we're still waiting for them to do work on it cos the excess and the insurance is five hundred pounds and I don't want anyone else the insurers to know if it's under five hundred fine just going to sort it out myself even if it's six hundred I will pay and the man was initially no it's fine we'll bash it out and then he looked at it again and actually the alignment's really not great and he was like turn on your headlights and so I turned them on and cos it was slightly bashed one of them on the brick wall was like here the other one was here it's like it's definitely not right so I haven't told dad that yet
oh no
so I haven't told dad that yet oh it's a nightmare and I couldn't go on the driver awareness course because I was too much over the limit which I think is really wrong because
course
you should have to go on the course and get points but no no
you're the one that needs it
so you just have to have the points
there's always something with cars

dad said to me there's no point buying a new car cos a new driver driving out of the forecourt losing value something crazy like it loses two and a half grand just by driving out of the car park so that was a bit of a nightmare before Christmas
my engine light came on again did I tell you about the engine light?
you're not in the Clio any more?
yeah
you are?
Clio
Cleopatra
the engine light came on we were driving down to Dorset me and and then just like what does that mean? amber light that looks like an engine
I know that one overheating
pulled over and it could be absolutely anything and if it's not red it should be fine
did you find somewhere when you got to Dorset?

of course we couldn't find anywhere in Dorset and ended up going all the way back to Reading and it was something really stupid like and when I went back to Bristol for Christmas and when I got onto the motorway engine light went on
oh my

it's really frightening on the motorway no it was orange if it was red I would of stopped my dad picked my tyres and they were a bit flat and said what shall I do? and he was like oh they'll be alright
put air in them
that was costing a lot more petrol
yeah I get scared of doing that cos I never know if I'm doing it right I'm paranoid I don't know the amount I get a stranger to do it I act like oh I don't know
I'm like every now and then my dad checks my car cos he knows I don't check it cos I never check anything once I'm out of the car I forget about the car once I shut the door off you go
yeah
I never checked my oil and I've had my car for about five years

but it flashes up oil on my dashboard okay when I stop the engine so I'm like great anyway the other day I was going to come home and go to my sister's for dinner and then drive back from my sister's to Reading driving to my sister's it was like der der der anti lock kn the breaks and that grinding sound
sound quite scary

I was thinking what was this I said to my dad and dad I'm sitting in the car I don't want to go back to Reading the breaks are going to fail and so I got them in the car and dad would slam on the breaks and said they were quite good but yeah it was like the RAC man and he drove and there were a few things the tracking is out the but it is just your anti lock breaking that's what it is
my anti locking comes in really quickly and that really scares me
what is it?

it's like if you're breaking quite hard anti locking is there to slow you down in my head this is the road rather than slowly slowing down it's trying to work hardest it's going der der der breaking harder on each bit it's fucking terrifying that was when I went into the rails with that dent der der der
seriously

yeah it's fine drove back to Reading my dad drove it out into the lanes and they're like it's fine but I drive my sister's car slightly different model put on the breaks and was literally like woah but mine it am I going to stop? am I going to stop? yeah that's good that's what I thought with that railing coming towards me just stop
railings yeah do

so I drove it back to Reading and when I got onto the motorway it was really raining and there were vans and then my ABS light comes on my dashboard and there's a problem with my anti lock breaking system and it's in the garage and it's all the time it's service coming up
shit done to it again
what my dad said can't always be paying for your car

I just pay the car really so they had to pay the tax and the other day I was driving back from somewhere I don't know where I was driving back from oh yeah through and I was daydreaming and I realised I was going at forty just where the speed camera is over those lines so I slowed down but I don't know if I did fast enough unfortunately I also found out that my tax had run out the day before so if I do catch me so I'm hoping the speed camera hasn't caught
a lot of them don't have film in
yeah I'm hoping that hasn't happened it's bad enough them catching me speeding but it's also bad if it's the day I got tax the next day but that was the day that I was speeding
oh so annoying
I'm always so careful with it cos I know where the speed cameras so I always go down to thirty
and I'm pretty sure I've been in the car with you when you're driving slowly anyway

yeah and I'm not a speeder I'm just driving yeah I'm always so careful I always find when it's something when I'm singing along thinking yeah so when I was coming back from I was doing like seventy on the motorway I was like I can't be caught just going really slowly
what is the speed limit on the motorway?
seventy but it's
overtaking you always go beyond I'm always about seventy-five

no I was doing seventy nobody gets tickets on the motorway they're fine but there was a variable sixty so I went right down to sixty and I think other cars were going faster but erm but cos it was dark at this time there was a huge flash and I thought oh my god I hope it isn't me they're flashing I was like I am doing sixty and I was like oh my god maybe it was fifty and I read it wrong
if there were cars going along faster than you

yeah so it was flashing another car maybe cos I was like oh my god if I got caught twice for speeding in two days then that's not good news I'm so careful I've never had any points in my life or anything
who doesn't?
I can't afford to pay fines right now
neither can I

I got paid we got paid a day less we got paid on twenty-first twenty-third we had to close our accounts down so we got paid three hundred and fifty dollars so I had that to bring home for me and it was only like a hundred and fifty pounds or something and so I've had to last me this month which is mostly like gone and
yeah oh wow doing well then
well I suppose you're back with your parents you're not paying rent

well I didn't have to pay rent in Peru because it was provided with our internship and when we worked it out we were working ten hours a day five days a week so we were working fifty hours a week and I was getting two hundred pounds the equivalent of getting paid in dollars but they couldn't so it worked out I was being paid a pound an hour but then we have got we have our flat provided and we got health insurance with that that we did actually end up using
why what was wrong?
erm I think must have used I woke up one day and I was being sick and I couldn't go into work and then I erm I thought I got a bug and then the next day I had diarrhoea and it had blood in it
oh

and I thought maybe and anyway this happened for a whole day and I got to the point where there was nothing to come out either end but it was still trying to come out and really painful so I rang my mum and she was like maybe go to the hospital so I went to the hospital and I went into the doctor's and it sounds like you've got cos here we have bacteria in food that we sometimes get and it sounds like you've got a bacterial infection so I'll give you antibiotics and if it gets worse just comes back the next week so I took the antibiotics and it cleared up so it must have been an infection erm but yeah so I used that but they paid not for the doctor so I had to pay to go to the doctor and to have to pay fifty soles which was only about ten pounds and then I had to pay for my antibiotics which were like twenty soles which is only like four pounds which I guess isn't that much but seventy soles is in Peru it goes a lot further than it does in England cos everything's a lot cheaper so it was like oh god
it's like that all over America and obviously you pay you can't afford it you just want to be done with it

it would have been so much more expensive cos that was only ten percent with my health insurance that was only ten percent of what the actual cost was so I was like oh my god I wouldn't of been able to pay that if I didn't have my insurance always worth getting insurance if your dog has insurance
oh but they cost a fortune too
yeah and my parents did that they had eight hundred pounds for my cat's paw to have like a skin graft
how much?
